intro: Silene lagenocalyx, commonly known as the large-cup silene, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Silene lagenocalyx plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
